full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is soliciting bids for the acquisition of a X-Ray Fluorescence Analyzer on behalf of the Department of Natural Resources (NRCan).

## Tender Details

* **Solicitation Number:** WS3989917575
* **Publication Date:** September 7, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** September 25, 2023 at 14:00 Eastern Daylight Time (EDT)
* **Contract Term:** One year starting from the date of contract award

## Mandatory Requirements

Bidders must meet the mandatory requirements outlined in the Request for Proposal.

## Contract Location and Delivery

Delivery must be made to Ottawa, Ontario, with a completion deadline of January 31, 2024.

## Evaluation Criteria

The procurement will be conducted based on the "Lowest Price" criteria.

## Trade Agreements

This procurement is subject to the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), and Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

## Contact Information

The contracting authority is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), with contact information below:

* Renee Lepage, PSPC
* Email: renee.lepage@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

## Notice and Supporting Documents

The tender notice can be accessed at [Ariba Discovery](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17386938?extsite=MTczODY5MzhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==). No attachments are available for this procurement.

## Important Notes

Amendment to closing time: Please disregard the Ariba Discovery posting response deadline closing time and CanadaBuys posting closing time. All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by the tender closing date.

## Bids Submission Deadline

All bids must be submitted by September 25, 2023 at 14:00 Eastern Daylight Time (EDT) to be considered valid.

Note: All non-compliant bids will be declared nonresponsive. Delivery must be received on or before January 31, 2024, as specified in the Request for Proposal.  Any questions and inquiries should be directed to the contactperson listed above. """
